release.action: Using the unit dlu in a JavaFX splitter component no longer causes an exception.
JavaFX panels can now be assigned basic attributes like color or font.
JavaFX tables now correctly evaluate the multi-selection flag.
JavaFX labels can now be assigned an icon. The ClassCastException that occurred in this case has been fixed.
The JavaFX application is now correctly set up so that the primary stage can be created successfully in JavaFX 8.
The build of JGUIraffe is now possible with both Java 7 and Java 8.
JavaFX is now supported as target platform.
The default value of the canShrink property of PercentLayoutBase was changed from false to true. This is appropriate for the majority of use cases.
SwingMessageOutput no longer allows HTML-based formatting. Leading and trailing html tags are removed from the message text.
SwingMessageOutput now allows specifying a maximum line length. Message texts are processed so that no line exceeds the specified length. Line wrapping is enabled per default.
The documentation of the MessageOutput interface was improved regarding the way the passed in message text is processed.
The colrenderer tag now works as expected in Swing.
Editable tree view components now work correctly in Swing.
Editable combo boxes no longer throw an exception in Swing.
Added the tag di:resource to resolve resources on the class path.
Colors now support a logic representation. This is useful for instance when dealing with style sheets. The serialization format and the string representation of class Color have changed.
Added OSGi support.
Improvements of the dependency injection framework related to factory beans and builder classes.
SwingTableComponentHandler now ensures that a newly selected row (in single-selection mode) becomes visible. If necessary, it changes the position of the scroll pane.
Updated test dependency to EasyMock to the most recent version 3.0.
Added a transformer to StaticTextData objects which simpliefies usage of static text controls in forms.
Builders could throw an undocumented LocatorException. Such exceptions are now caught and re-thrown as BuilderException exceptions.
Fixed a NullPointerException which can occur in the dependency injection framework when looking up beans by classes rather than bean names.
